results.title: Landscape
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Exploring Photography”.
Deals with a wide variety of approaches to landscape photography, including the adventurous work of Ernst Haas and the more symbolic black and white of John Blakemore. Presented by Bryn Campbell.

results.title: The Portrait
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Exploring Photography”.
Aims to improve the viewers’ understanding of portrait photography as a creative medium and to increase their awareness of the visual options available to them as photographers. Several still photographers discuss their work.

results.title: Movement
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Exploring Photography”.
One of a series aimed to improve the viewer’s awareness of movement in photography as a creative medium and to increase their understanding of visual options. Several photographers discuss their techniques and show pictures of their style, including Ernst Haas, famous for his highly original colour photographs.

results.title: Muscular strength and endurance
results.creator_credit: D. David Bash and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyone’s a Winner”.
Describes a program for developing strength and endurance of the upper body, arms and abdominal muscles. Includes the correct ways to do knee-bent situps, chair pushups and pullups, and how to limber up before exercising.

results.title: Warlords and Widows the Maronites of Lebanon
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
This film focuses on the Maronites of Lebanon and is Part Two of a two-part investigation that explores the underlying beliefs, emotions and antagonisms that have resulted in the battles between the Christians and the Islamics of the Middle East.

results.title: Heaven's My Destination
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
Since returning from the moon many astronauts have testified to the strong spiritual impact the space experience has had on them. A number have committed themselves to Christ and Ed Mitchell has founded the Institute of Noetic Sciences. This program looks at how space travel has given these men a new perception of man’s place in the universe.

results.title: Prisoners of Conscience
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
The case histories of Gustavo Westerkamp and Danylo Shumuk who were imprisoned for their religious and political beliefs are examined and the work of Amnesty International
